text: Ratko Mladić (, ; born March 12, 1942) is a Bosnian Serb convicted Yugoslav war criminal and colonel-general. ==Career== Ratko Mladic served in the Yugoslav Military from 1965-1996 he was promoted to Lieutenant-Colonel in 1980 later a Colonel in 1986 . He was then promoted to Major-General in 1991 and in 1992 he became Lieutenant Colonel General. He led the Army of Republika Srpska (VRS) during the Yugoslav Wars. * * * ==War crimes trial== In 2017, he was found guilty of committing war crimes, crimes against humanity, and genocide by the International Criminal Tribunal for the former Yugoslavia (ICTY) for leading the siege of Sarajevo and the Srebrenica massacre. ==Related pages== * Bosnian genocide * Yugoslav massacres of Kosovo Albanians during the Kosovo War ==References== Category:1942 births Category:Living people Category:War criminals Category:Bosnian genocide Category:Yugoslavian military people Category:Bosnia and Herzegovina people Category:People convicted of manslaughter
